definition: Smooth and finish surfaces of poured concrete, such as floors, walks, sidewalks, roads, or curbs using a variety of hand and power tools. Align forms for sidewalks, curbs, or gutters; patch voids; and use saws to cut expansion joints.

LABEL: terrazzo worker or finisher
SubClass Of [NAMED]: cement mason, concrete finisher, or terrazzo worker
definition: Apply a mixture of cement, sand, pigment, or marble chips to floors, stairways, and cabinet fixtures to fashion durable and decorative surfaces.

LABEL: construction laborer
definition: Perform tasks involving physical labor at construction sites. May operate hand and power tools of all types: air hammers, earth tampers, cement mixers, small mechanical hoists, surveying and measuring equipment, and a variety of other equipment and instruments. May clean and prepare sites, dig trenches, set braces to support the sides of excavations, erect scaffolding, and clean up rubble, debris, and other waste materials. May assist other craft workers.

LABEL: paving, surfacing, or tamping equipment operator
alternative term: Paving, Surfacing, and Tamping Equipment Operators
definition: Operate equipment used for applying concrete, asphalt, or other materials to road beds, parking lots, or airport runways and taxiways or for tamping gravel, dirt, or other materials. Includes concrete and asphalt paving machine operators, form tampers, tamping machine operators, and stone spreader operators.

LABEL: operating engineer or other construction equipment operator
alternative term: Operating Engineers and Other Construction Equipment Operators
definition: Operate one or several types of power construction equipment, such as motor graders, bulldozers, scrapers, compressors, pumps, derricks, shovels, tractors, or front-end loaders to excavate, move, and grade earth, erect structures, or pour concrete or other hard surface pavement. May repair and maintain equipment in addition to other duties.

LABEL: drywall or ceiling tile installer
SubClass Of [NAMED]: drywall installer, ceiling tile installer, or taper
definition: Apply plasterboard or other wallboard to ceilings or interior walls of buildings. Apply or mount acoustical tiles or blocks, strips, or sheets of shock-absorbing materials to ceilings and walls of buildings to reduce or reflect sound. Materials may be of decorative quality. Includes lathers who fasten wooden, metal, or rockboard lath to walls, ceilings, or partitions of buildings to provide support base for plaster, fireproofing, or acoustical material.

LABEL: taper
SubClass Of [NAMED]: drywall installer, ceiling tile installer, or taper
definition: Seal joints between plasterboard or other wallboard to prepare wall surface for painting or papering.

LABEL: electrician
definition: Install, maintain, and repair electrical wiring, equipment, and fixtures. Ensure that work is in accordance with relevant codes. May install or service street lights, intercom systems, or electrical control systems.

LABEL: glazier
definition: Install glass in windows, skylights, store fronts, and display cases, or on surfaces, such as building fronts, interior walls, ceilings, and tabletops.

LABEL: insulation worker, floor, ceiling, or wall
alternative term: Insulation Workers, Floor, Ceiling, and Wall
definition: Line and cover structures with insulating materials. May work with batt, roll, or blown insulation materials.

LABEL: insulation worker, mechanical
definition: Apply insulating materials to pipes or ductwork, or other mechanical systems in order to help control and maintain temperature.

LABEL: painter, construction or maintenance
definition: Paint walls, equipment, buildings, bridges, and other structural surfaces, using brushes, rollers, and spray guns. May remove old paint to prepare surface prior to painting. May mix colors or oils to obtain desired color or consistency.

LABEL: paperhanger
definition: Cover interior walls or ceilings of rooms with decorative wallpaper or fabric, or attach advertising posters on surfaces such as walls and billboards. May remove old materials or prepare surfaces to be papered.

LABEL: pipelayer
definition: Lay pipe for storm or sanitation sewers, drains, and water mains. Perform any combination of the following tasks: grade trenches or culverts, position pipe, or seal joints.

LABEL: plumber, pipefitter, or steamfitter
definition: Assemble, install, alter, and repair pipelines or pipe systems that carry water, steam, air, or other liquids or gases. May install heating and cooling equipment and mechanical control systems. Includes sprinkler fitters.

LABEL: solar thermal installer or technician
definition: Install or repair solar energy systems designed to collect, store, and circulate solar-heated water for residential, commercial or industrial use.

LABEL: plasterer or stucco mason
definition: Apply interior or exterior plaster, cement, stucco, or similar materials. May also set ornamental plaster.

LABEL: reinforcing iron or rebar worker
definition: Position and secure steel bars or mesh in concrete forms in order to reinforce concrete. Use a variety of fasteners, rod-bending machines, blowtorches, and hand tools. Includes rod busters.

LABEL: roofer
definition: Cover roofs of structures with shingles, slate, asphalt, aluminum, wood, or related materials. May spray roofs, sidings, and walls with material to bind, seal, insulate, or soundproof sections of structures.

LABEL: sheet metal worker
definition: Fabricate, assemble, install, and repair sheet metal products and equipment, such as ducts, control boxes, drainpipes, and furnace casings. Work may involve any of the following: setting up and operating fabricating machines to cut, bend, and straighten sheet metal; shaping metal over anvils, blocks, or forms using hammer; operating soldering and welding equipment to join sheet metal parts; or inspecting, assembling, and smoothing seams and joints of burred surfaces. Includes sheet metal duct installers who install prefabricated sheet metal ducts used for heating, air conditioning, or other purposes.

LABEL: structural iron or steel worker
definition: Raise, place, and unite iron or steel girders, columns, and other structural members to form completed structures or structural frameworks. May erect metal storage tanks and assemble prefabricated metal buildings.

LABEL: solar photovoltaic installer
definition: Assemble, install, or maintain solar photovoltaic (PV) systems on roofs or other structures in compliance with site assessment and schematics. May include measuring, cutting, assembling, and bolting structural framing and solar modules. May perform minor electrical work such as current checks.

LABEL: helper-brickmason, blockmason, stonemason, or tile or marble setter
alternative term: Helpers--Brickmasons, Blockmasons, Stonemasons, and Tile and Marble Setters
definition: Help brickmasons, blockmasons, stonemasons, or tile and marble setters by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include using, supplying, or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment.

LABEL: helpers--carpenter
definition: Help carpenters by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include using, supplying, or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment.

LABEL: helpers--electrician
definition: Help electricians by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include using, supplying, or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment.

LABEL: helpers--painter, paperhanger, plasterer, or stucco mason
alternative term: Helpers--Painters, Paperhangers, Plasterers, and Stucco Masons
definition: Help painters, paperhangers, plasterers, or stucco masons by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include using, supplying, or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment.

LABEL: helpers--pipelayer, plumber, pipefitter, or steamfitter
definition: Help plumbers, pipefitters, steamfitters, or pipelayers by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include using, supplying, or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment.

LABEL: helpers--roofer
definition: Help roofers by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include using, supplying, or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment.

LABEL: construction or building inspector
definition: Inspect structures using engineering skills to determine structural soundness and compliance with specifications, building codes, and other regulations. Inspections may be general in nature or may be limited to a specific area, such as electrical systems or plumbing.

LABEL: energy auditor
definition: Conduct energy audits of buildings, building systems, or process systems. May also conduct investment grade audits of buildings or systems.

LABEL: fence erector
definition: Erect and repair fences and fence gates, using hand and power tools.

LABEL: hazardous materials removal worker
definition: Identify, remove, pack, transport, or dispose of hazardous materials, including asbestos, lead-based paint, waste oil, fuel, transmission fluid, radioactive materials, or contaminated soil. Specialized training and certification in hazardous materials handling or a confined entry permit are generally required. May operate earth-moving equipment or trucks.

LABEL: highway maintenance worker
definition: Maintain highways, municipal and rural roads, airport runways, and rights-of-way. Duties include patching broken or eroded pavement and repairing guard rails, highway markers, and snow fences. May also mow or clear brush from along road, or plow snow from roadway.

LABEL: rail-track laying or maintenance equipment operator
SubClass Of [NAMED]: rail-track laying or maintenance equipment operator (broad)
alternative term: Rail-Track Laying and Maintenance Equipment Operators
definition: Lay, repair, and maintain track for standard or narrow-gauge railroad equipment used in regular railroad service or in plant yards, quarries, sand and gravel pits, and mines. Includes ballast cleaning machine operators and railroad bed tamping machine operators.

LABEL: septic tank servicer or sewer pipe cleaner
SubClass Of [NAMED]: septic tank servicer or sewer pipe cleaner (broad)
alternative term: Septic Tank Servicers and Sewer Pipe Cleaners
definition: Clean and repair septic tanks, sewer lines, or drains. May patch walls and partitions of tank, replace damaged drain tile, or repair breaks in underground piping.

LABEL: segmental paver
definition: Lay out, cut, and place segmental paving units. Includes installers of bedding and restraining materials for the paving units.

LABEL: weatherization installer or technician
definition: Perform a variety of activities to weatherize homes and make them more energy efficient. Duties include repairing windows, insulating ducts, and performing heating, ventilating, and air-conditioning (HVAC) work. May perform energy audits and advise clients on energy conservation measures.

LABEL: derrick operator, oil or ga
SubClass Of [NAMED]: derrick, rotary drill, or service unit operator, oil or gas
definition: Rig derrick equipment and operate pumps to circulate mud or fluid through drill hole.

LABEL: rotary drill operator, oil or ga
SubClass Of [NAMED]: derrick, rotary drill, or service unit operator, oil or gas
alternative term: Rotary Drill Operators, Oil and Gas
definition: Set up or operate a variety of drills to remove underground oil and gas, or remove core samples for testing during oil and gas exploration.

LABEL: earth driller, except oil or ga
SubClass Of [NAMED]: surface mining machine operator or earth driller
alternative term: Earth Drillers, Except Oil and Gas
definition: Operate a variety of drills such as rotary, churn, and pneumatic to tap subsurface water and salt deposits, to remove core samples during mineral exploration or soil testing, and to facilitate the use of explosives in mining or construction. Includes horizontal and earth boring machine operators.

LABEL: explosives worker, ordnance handling expert, or blaster
SubClass Of [NAMED]: explosives worker, ordnance handling expert, or blaster (broad)
alternative term: Explosives Workers, Ordnance Handling Experts, and Blasters
definition: Place and detonate explosives to demolish structures or to loosen, remove, or displace earth, rock, or other materials. May perform specialized handling, storage, and accounting procedures.

LABEL: continuous mining machine operator
definition: Operate self-propelled mining machines that rip coal, metal and nonmetal ores, rock, stone, or sand from the mine face and load it onto conveyors, shuttle cars, or trucks in a continuous operation.

LABEL: roof bolter, mining
definition: Operate machinery to install roof support bolts in underground mine.

LABEL: rock splitter, quarry
definition: Separate blocks of rough dimension stone from quarry mass using jackhammers, wedges, or chop saws.

LABEL: roustabout, oil or ga
definition: Assemble or repair oil field equipment using hand and power tools. Perform other tasks as needed.

LABEL: helpers--extraction worker
definition: Help extraction craft workers, such as earth drillers, blasters and explosives workers, derrick operators, and mining machine operators, by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include supplying equipment or cleaning work area.

LABEL: first-line supervisor of mechanics, installer, or repairer
SubClass Of [NAMED]: first-line supervisor of mechanic, installer, or repairer
alternative term: First-Line Supervisors of Mechanics, Installers, and Repairers
definition: Directly supervise and coordinate the activities of mechanics, installers, and repairers. May also advise customers on recommended services. Excludes team or work leaders.

LABEL: computer, automated teller, or office machine repairer
SubClass Of [NAMED]: computer, automated teller, or office machine repairer (broad)
alternative term: Computer, Automated Teller, and Office Machine Repairers
definition: Repair, maintain, or install computers, word processing systems, automated teller machines, and electronic office machines, such as duplicating and fax machines.

LABEL: radio, cellular, or tower equipment installer or repairer
SubClass Of [NAMED]: radio or telecommunications equipment installer or repairer
alternative term: Radio, Cellular, and Tower Equipment Installers and Repairers
definition: Repair, install, or maintain mobile or stationary radio transmitting, broadcasting, and receiving equipment, and two-way radio communications systems used in cellular telecommunications, mobile broadband, ship-to-shore, aircraft-to-ground communications, and radio equipment in service and emergency vehicles. May test and analyze network coverage.

LABEL: telecommunications equipment installer or repairer, except line installer
SubClass Of [NAMED]: radio or telecommunications equipment installer or repairer
alternative term: Telecommunications Equipment Installers and Repairers, Except Line Installers
definition: Install, set up, rearrange, or remove switching, distribution, routing, and dialing equipment used in central offices or headends. Service or repair telephone, cable television, Internet, and other communications equipment on customers' property. May install communications equipment or communications wiring in buildings.

LABEL: avionics technician
SubClass Of [NAMED]: miscellaneous electrical or electronic equipment mechanic, installer, or repairer
definition: Install, inspect, test, adjust, or repair avionics equipment, such as radar, radio, navigation, and missile control systems in aircraft or space vehicles.

LABEL: electric motor, power tool, or related repairer
SubClass Of [NAMED]: miscellaneous electrical or electronic equipment mechanic, installer, or repairer
alternative term: Electric Motor, Power Tool, and Related Repairers
definition: Repair, maintain, or install electric motors, wiring, or switches.

LABEL: electrical or electronics installer or repairer, transportation equipment
SubClass Of [NAMED]: miscellaneous electrical or electronic equipment mechanic, installer, or repairer
alternative term: Electrical and Electronics Installers and Repairers, Transportation Equipment
definition: Install, adjust, or maintain mobile electronics communication equipment, including sound, sonar, security, navigation, and surveillance systems on trains, watercraft, or other mobile equipment.

LABEL: electrical or electronics repairer, commercial or industrial equipment
SubClass Of [NAMED]: miscellaneous electrical or electronic equipment mechanic, installer, or repairer
alternative term: Electrical and Electronics Repairers, Commercial and Industrial Equipment
definition: Repair, test, adjust, or install electronic equipment, such as industrial controls, transmitters, and antennas.

LABEL: electrical or electronics repairer, powerhouse, substation, or relay
SubClass Of [NAMED]: miscellaneous electrical or electronic equipment mechanic, installer, or repairer
alternative term: Electrical and Electronics Repairers, Powerhouse, Substation, and Relay
definition: Inspect, test, repair, or maintain electrical equipment in generating stations, substations, and in-service relays.

LABEL: electronic equipment installer or repairer, motor vehicle
SubClass Of [NAMED]: miscellaneous electrical or electronic equipment mechanic, installer, or repairer
alternative term: Electronic Equipment Installers and Repairers, Motor Vehicles
definition: Install, diagnose, or repair communications, sound, security, or navigation equipment in motor vehicles.

LABEL: security or fire alarm systems installer
SubClass Of [NAMED]: miscellaneous electrical or electronic equipment mechanic, installer, or repairer
alternative term: Security and Fire Alarm Systems Installers
definition: Install, program, maintain, and repair security and fire alarm wiring and equipment. Ensure that work is in accordance with relevant codes.

LABEL: aircraft mechanics or service technician
definition: Diagnose, adjust, repair, or overhaul aircraft engines and assemblies, such as hydraulic and pneumatic systems.

LABEL: automotive body or related repairer
definition: Repair and refinish automotive vehicle bodies and straighten vehicle frames.

LABEL: automotive glass installer or repairer
definition: Replace or repair broken windshields and window glass in motor vehicles.

LABEL: bus or truck mechanic or diesel engine specialist
SubClass Of [NAMED]: bus or truck mechanic or diesel engine specialist (broad)
alternative term: Bus and Truck Mechanics and Diesel Engine Specialists
definition: Diagnose, adjust, repair, or overhaul buses and trucks, or maintain and repair any type of diesel engines. Includes mechanics working primarily with automobile or marine diesel engines.

LABEL: farm equipment mechanic or service technician
SubClass Of [NAMED]: heavy vehicle or mobile equipment service technician or mechanic
alternative term: Farm Equipment Mechanics and Service Technicians
definition: Diagnose, adjust, repair, or overhaul farm machinery and vehicles, such as tractors, harvesters, dairy equipment, and irrigation systems.

LABEL: mobile heavy equipment mechanic, except engine
SubClass Of [NAMED]: heavy vehicle or mobile equipment service technician or mechanic
alternative term: Mobile Heavy Equipment Mechanics, Except Engines
definition: Diagnose, adjust, repair, or overhaul mobile mechanical, hydraulic, and pneumatic equipment, such as cranes, bulldozers, graders, and conveyors, used in construction, logging, and mining.

LABEL: rail car repairer
SubClass Of [NAMED]: heavy vehicle or mobile equipment service technician or mechanic
definition: Diagnose, adjust, repair, or overhaul railroad rolling stock, mine cars, or mass transit rail cars.

LABEL: motorboat mechanic or service technician
definition: Repair and adjust electrical and mechanical equipment of inboard or inboard-outboard boat engines.

LABEL: motorcycle mechanic
definition: Diagnose, adjust, repair, or overhaul motorcycles, scooters, mopeds, dirt bikes, or similar motorized vehicles.

LABEL: outdoor power equipment or other small engine mechanic
alternative term: Outdoor Power Equipment and Other Small Engine Mechanics
definition: Diagnose, adjust, repair, or overhaul small engines used to power lawn mowers, chain saws, recreational sporting equipment, and related equipment.

LABEL: bicycle repairer
SubClass Of [NAMED]: miscellaneous vehicle or mobile equipment mechanic, installer, or repairer
definition: Repair and service bicycles.

LABEL: recreational vehicle service technician
SubClass Of [NAMED]: miscellaneous vehicle or mobile equipment mechanic, installer, or repairer
definition: Diagnose, inspect, adjust, repair, or overhaul recreational vehicles including travel trailers. May specialize in maintaining gas, electrical, hydraulic, plumbing, or chassis/towing systems as well as repairing generators, appliances, and interior components. Includes workers who perform customized van conversions.

LABEL: tire repairer or changer
SubClass Of [NAMED]: miscellaneous vehicle or mobile equipment mechanic, installer, or repairer
definition: Repair and replace tires.

LABEL: mechanical door repairer
SubClass Of [NAMED]: control or valve installer or repairer
definition: Install, service, or repair automatic door mechanisms and hydraulic doors. Includes garage door mechanics.

LABEL: control or valve installer or repairer, except mechanical door
SubClass Of [NAMED]: control or valve installer or repairer
alternative term: Control and Valve Installers and Repairers, Except Mechanical Door
definition: Install, repair, and maintain mechanical regulating and controlling devices, such as electric meters, gas regulators, thermostats, safety and flow valves, and other mechanical governors.

LABEL: home appliance repairer
definition: Repair, adjust, or install all types of electric or gas household appliances, such as refrigerators, washers, dryers, and ovens.

LABEL: industrial machinery mechanic
SubClass Of [NAMED]: industrial machinery installation, repair, or maintenance worker
definition: Repair, install, adjust, or maintain industrial production and processing machinery or refinery and pipeline distribution systems. May also install, dismantle, or move machinery and heavy equipment according to plans.

LABEL: maintenance worker, machinery
SubClass Of [NAMED]: industrial machinery installation, repair, or maintenance worker
definition: Lubricate machinery, change parts, or perform other routine machinery maintenance.

LABEL: millwright
SubClass Of [NAMED]: industrial machinery installation, repair, or maintenance worker
definition: Install, dismantle, or move machinery and heavy equipment according to layout plans, blueprints, or other drawings.

LABEL: refractory materials repairer, except brickmason
SubClass Of [NAMED]: industrial machinery installation, repair, or maintenance worker
definition: Build or repair equipment such as furnaces, kilns, cupolas, boilers, converters, ladles, soaking pits, and ovens, using refractory materials.

LABEL: electrical power-line installer or repairer
definition: Install or repair cables or wires used in electrical power or distribution systems. May erect poles and light or heavy duty transmission towers.

LABEL: telecommunications line installer or repairer
definition: Install and repair telecommunications cable, including fiber optics.

LABEL: camera or photographic equipment repairer
definition: Repair and adjust cameras and photographic equipment, including commercial video and motion picture camera equipment.

LABEL: medical equipment repairer
definition: Test, adjust, or repair biomedical or electromedical equipment.

LABEL: musical instrument repairer or tuner
definition: Repair percussion, stringed, reed, or wind instruments. May specialize in one area, such as piano tuning.

LABEL: maintenance or repair worker, general
definition: Perform work involving the skills of two or more maintenance or craft occupations to keep machines, mechanical equipment, or the structure of a building in repair. Duties may involve pipe fitting; HVAC maintenance; insulating; welding; machining; carpentry; repairing electrical or mechanical equipment; installing, aligning, and balancing new equipment; and repairing buildings, floors, or stairs.

LABEL: wind turbine service technician
definition: Inspect, diagnose, adjust, or repair wind turbines. Perform maintenance on wind turbine equipment including resolving electrical, mechanical, and hydraulic malfunctions.

LABEL: coin, vending, or amusement machine servicer or repairer
SubClass Of [NAMED]: miscellaneous installation, maintenance, or repair worker
alternative term: Coin, Vending, and Amusement Machine Servicers and Repairers
definition: Install, service, adjust, or repair coin, vending, or amusement machines including video games, juke boxes, pinball machines, or slot machines.

LABEL: commercial diver
SubClass Of [NAMED]: miscellaneous installation, maintenance, or repair worker
definition: Work below surface of water, using surface-supplied air or scuba equipment to inspect, repair, remove, or install equipment and structures. May use a variety of power and hand tools, such as drills, sledgehammers, torches, and welding equipment. May conduct tests or experiments, rig explosives, or photograph structures or marine life.

LABEL: locksmith or safe repairer
SubClass Of [NAMED]: miscellaneous installation, maintenance, or repair worker
definition: Repair and open locks, make keys, change locks and safe combinations, and install and repair safes.

LABEL: manufactured building or mobile home installer
SubClass Of [NAMED]: miscellaneous installation, maintenance, or repair worker
alternative term: Manufactured Building and Mobile Home Installers
definition: Move or install mobile homes or prefabricated buildings.

LABEL: rigger
SubClass Of [NAMED]: miscellaneous installation, maintenance, or repair worker
definition: Set up or repair rigging for construction projects, manufacturing plants, logging yards, ships and shipyards, or for the entertainment industry.

LABEL: signal or track switch repairer
SubClass Of [NAMED]: miscellaneous installation, maintenance, or repair worker
definition: Install, inspect, test, maintain, or repair electric gate crossings, signals, signal equipment, track switches, section lines, or intercommunications systems within a railroad system.

LABEL: helpers--installation, maintenance, or repair worker
SubClass Of [NAMED]: miscellaneous installation, maintenance, or repair worker
definition: Help installation, maintenance, and repair workers in maintenance, parts replacement, and repair of vehicles, industrial machinery, and electrical and electronic equipment. Perform duties such as furnishing tools, materials, and supplies to other workers; cleaning work area, machines, and tools; and holding materials or tools for other workers.

LABEL: geothermal technician
SubClass Of [NAMED]: miscellaneous installation, maintenance, or repair worker
definition: Perform technical activities at power plants or individual installations necessary for the generation of power from geothermal energy sources. Monitor and control operating activities at geothermal power generation facilities and perform maintenance and repairs as necessary. Install, test, and maintain residential and commercial geothermal heat pumps.

LABEL: first-line supervisor of production or operating worker
SubClass Of [NAMED]: first-line supervisor of production or operating worker (broad)
alternative term: First-Line Supervisors of Production and Operating Workers
definition: Directly supervise and coordinate the activities of production and operating workers, such as inspectors, precision workers, machine setters and operators, assemblers, fabricators, and plant and system operators. Excludes team or work leaders.

LABEL: aircraft structure, surfaces, rigging, or systems assembler
SubClass Of [NAMED]: aircraft structure, surfaces, rigging, or systems assembler (broad)
alternative term: Aircraft Structure, Surfaces, Rigging, and Systems Assemblers
definition: Assemble, fit, fasten, and install parts of airplanes, space vehicles, or missiles, such as tails, wings, fuselage, bulkheads, stabilizers, landing gear, rigging and control equipment, or heating and ventilating systems.

LABEL: coil winder, taper, or finisher
definition: Wind wire coils used in electrical components, such as resistors and transformers, and in electrical equipment and instruments, such as field cores, bobbins, armature cores, electrical motors, generators, and control equipment.

LABEL: electrical or electronic equipment assembler
definition: Assemble or modify electrical or electronic equipment, such as computers, test equipment telemetering systems, electric motors, and batteries.

LABEL: electromechanical equipment assembler
definition: Assemble or modify electromechanical equipment or devices, such as servomechanisms, gyros, dynamometers, magnetic drums, tape drives, brakes, control linkage, actuators, and appliances.

LABEL: engine or other machine assembler
definition: Construct, assemble, or rebuild machines, such as engines, turbines, and similar equipment used in such industries as construction, extraction, textiles, and paper manufacturing.

LABEL: structural metal fabricator or fitter
definition: Fabricate, position, align, and fit parts of structural metal products.

LABEL: fiberglass laminator or fabricator
definition: Laminate layers of fiberglass on molds to form boat decks and hulls, bodies for golf carts, automobiles, or other products.

LABEL: timing device assembler or adjuster
definition: Perform precision assembling or adjusting, within narrow tolerances, of timing devices such as digital clocks or timing devices with electrical or electronic components.

LABEL: team assembler
definition: Work as part of a team having responsibility for assembling an entire product or component of a product. Team assemblers can perform all tasks conducted by the team in the assembly process and rotate through all or most of them, rather than being assigned to a specific task on a permanent basis. May participate in making management decisions affecting the work. Includes team leaders who work as part of the team.

LABEL: baker
definition: Mix and bake ingredients to produce breads, rolls, cookies, cakes, pies, pastries, or other baked goods.

LABEL: butcher or meat cutter
SubClass Of [NAMED]: butcher or other meat, poultry, or fish processing worker
definition: Cut, trim, or prepare consumer-sized portions of meat for use or sale in retail establishments.

LABEL: meat, poultry, or fish cutter or trimmer
SubClass Of [NAMED]: butcher or other meat, poultry, or fish processing worker
alternative term: Meat, Poultry, and Fish Cutters and Trimmers
definition: Use hands or hand tools to perform routine cutting and trimming of meat, poultry, and seafood.

LABEL: slaughterer or meat packer
SubClass Of [NAMED]: butcher or other meat, poultry, or fish processing worker
definition: Perform nonroutine or precision functions involving the preparation of large portions of meat. Work may include specialized slaughtering tasks, cutting standard or premium cuts of meat for marketing, making sausage, or wrapping meats. Work typically occurs in slaughtering, meat packing, or wholesale establishments.

LABEL: food or tobacco roasting, baking, or drying machine operator or tender
alternative term: Food and Tobacco Roasting, Baking, and Drying Machine Operators and Tenders
definition: Operate or tend food or tobacco roasting, baking, or drying equipment, including hearth ovens, kiln driers, roasters, char kilns, and vacuum drying equipment.

LABEL: food batchmaker
definition: Set up and operate equipment that mixes or blends ingredients used in the manufacturing of food products. Includes candy makers and cheese makers.

LABEL: food cooking machine operator or tender
alternative term: Food Cooking Machine Operators and Tenders
definition: Operate or tend cooking equipment, such as steam cooking vats, deep fry cookers, pressure cookers, kettles, and boilers, to prepare food products.

LABEL: extruding or drawing machine setter, operator, or tender, metal or plastic
SubClass Of [NAMED]: forming machine setter, operator, or tender, metal or plastic
alternative term: Extruding and Drawing Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders, Metal and Plastic
definition: Set up, operate, or tend machines to extrude or draw thermoplastic or metal materials into tubes, rods, hoses, wire, bars, or structural shapes.

LABEL: forging machine setter, operator, or tender, metal or plastic
SubClass Of [NAMED]: forming machine setter, operator, or tender, metal or plastic
alternative term: Forging Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders, Metal and Plastic
definition: Set up, operate, or tend forging machines to taper, shape, or form metal or plastic parts.

LABEL: rolling machine setter, operator, or tender, metal or plastic
SubClass Of [NAMED]: forming machine setter, operator, or tender, metal or plastic
alternative term: Rolling Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders, Metal and Plastic
definition: Set up, operate, or tend machines to roll steel or plastic forming bends, beads, knurls, rolls, or plate, or to flatten, temper, or reduce gauge of material.

LABEL: cutting, punching, or press machine setter, operator, or tender, metal or plastic
SubClass Of [NAMED]: machine tool cutting setter, operator, or tender, metal or plastic
alternative term: Cutting, Punching, and Press Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders, Metal and Plastic
definition: Set up, operate, or tend machines to saw, cut, shear, slit, punch, crimp, notch, bend, or straighten metal or plastic material.

LABEL: drilling or boring machine tool setter, operator, or tender, metal or plastic
SubClass Of [NAMED]: machine tool cutting setter, operator, or tender, metal or plastic
alternative term: Drilling and Boring Machine Tool Setters, Operators, and Tenders, Metal and Plastic
definition: Set up, operate, or tend drilling machines to drill, bore, ream, mill, or countersink metal or plastic work pieces.

LABEL: grinding, lapping, polishing, or buffing machine tool setter, operator, or tender, metal or plastic
SubClass Of [NAMED]: machine tool cutting setter, operator, or tender, metal or plastic
alternative term: Grinding, Lapping, Polishing, and Buffing Machine Tool Setters, Operators, and Tenders, Metal and Plastic
definition: Set up, operate, or tend grinding and related tools that remove excess material or burrs from surfaces, sharpen edges or corners, or buff, hone, or polish metal or plastic work pieces.

LABEL: lathe or turning machine tool setter, operator, or tender, metal or plastic
SubClass Of [NAMED]: machine tool cutting setter, operator, or tender, metal or plastic
alternative term: Lathe and Turning Machine Tool Setters, Operators, and Tenders, Metal and Plastic
definition: Set up, operate, or tend lathe and turning machines to turn, bore, thread, form, or face metal or plastic materials, such as wire, rod, or bar stock.

LABEL: milling or planing machine setter, operator, or tender, metal or plastic
SubClass Of [NAMED]: machine tool cutting setter, operator, or tender, metal or plastic
alternative term: Milling and Planing Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders, Metal and Plastic
definition: Set up, operate, or tend milling or planing machines to mill, plane, shape, groove, or profile metal or plastic work pieces.

LABEL: machinist
definition: Set up and operate a variety of machine tools to produce precision parts and instruments out of metal. Includes precision instrument makers who fabricate, modify, or repair mechanical instruments. May also fabricate and modify parts to make or repair machine tools or maintain industrial machines, applying knowledge of mechanics, mathematics, metal properties, layout, and machining procedures.

LABEL: metal-refining furnace operator or tender
SubClass Of [NAMED]: metal furnace operator, tender, pourer, or caster
definition: Operate or tend furnaces, such as gas, oil, coal, electric-arc or electric induction, open-hearth, or oxygen furnaces, to melt and refine metal before casting or to produce specified types of steel.

LABEL: pourer or caster, metal
SubClass Of [NAMED]: metal furnace operator, tender, pourer, or caster
definition: Operate hand-controlled mechanisms to pour and regulate the flow of molten metal into molds to produce castings or ingots.

LABEL: model maker, metal or plastic
SubClass Of [NAMED]: model maker or patternmaker, metal or plastic
definition: Set up and operate machines, such as lathes, milling and engraving machines, and jig borers to make working models of metal or plastic objects. Includes template makers.

LABEL: patternmaker, metal or plastic
SubClass Of [NAMED]: model maker or patternmaker, metal or plastic
definition: Lay out, machine, fit, and assemble castings and parts to metal or plastic foundry patterns, core boxes, or match plates.

LABEL: foundry mold or coremaker
SubClass Of [NAMED]: molder or molding machine setter, operator, or tender, metal or plastic
definition: Make or form wax or sand cores or molds used in the production of metal castings in foundries.

LABEL: molding, coremaking, or casting machine setter, operator, or tender, metal or plastic
SubClass Of [NAMED]: molder or molding machine setter, operator, or tender, metal or plastic
alternative term: Molding, Coremaking, and Casting Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders, Metal and Plastic
definition: Set up, operate, or tend metal or plastic molding, casting, or coremaking machines to mold or cast metal or thermoplastic parts or products.

LABEL: multiple machine tool setter, operator, or tender, metal or plastic
SubClass Of [NAMED]: multiple machine tool setter, operator, or tender, metal or plastic (broad)
alternative term: Multiple Machine Tool Setters, Operators, and Tenders, Metal and Plastic
definition: Set up, operate, or tend more than one type of cutting or forming machine tool or robot.

LABEL: tool or die maker
definition: Analyze specifications, lay out metal stock, set up and operate machine tools, and fit and assemble parts to make and repair dies, cutting tools, jigs, fixtures, gauges, and machinists' hand tools.

LABEL: welding, soldering, or brazing machine setter, operator, or tender
alternative term: Welding, Soldering, and Brazing Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders
definition: Set up, operate, or tend welding, soldering, or brazing machines or robots that weld, braze, solder, or heat treat metal products, components, or assemblies. Includes workers who operate laser cutters or laser-beam machines.

LABEL: heat treating equipment setter, operator, or tender, metal or plastic
SubClass Of [NAMED]: miscellaneous metal worker or plastic worker
alternative term: Heat Treating Equipment Setters, Operators, and Tenders, Metal and Plastic
definition: Set up, operate, or tend heating equipment, such as heat-treating furnaces, flame-hardening machines, induction machines, soaking pits, or vacuum equipment to temper, harden, anneal, or heat treat metal or plastic objects.

LABEL: layout worker, metal or plastic
SubClass Of [NAMED]: miscellaneous metal worker or plastic worker
definition: Lay out reference points and dimensions on metal or plastic stock or workpieces, such as sheets, plates, tubes, structural shapes, castings, or machine parts, for further processing. Includes shipfitters.

LABEL: tool grinder, filer, or sharpener
SubClass Of [NAMED]: miscellaneous metal worker or plastic worker
definition: Perform precision smoothing, sharpening, polishing, or grinding of metal objects.

LABEL: prepress technician or worker
definition: Format and proof text and images submitted by designers and clients into finished pages that can be printed. Includes digital and photo typesetting. May produce printing plates.

LABEL: printing press operator
definition: Set up and operate digital, letterpress, lithographic, flexographic, gravure, or other printing machines. Includes short-run offset printing presses.

LABEL: print binding or finishing worker
definition: Bind books and other publications or finish printed products by hand or machine. May set up binding and finishing machines.

LABEL: laundry or dry-cleaning worker
definition: Operate or tend washing or dry-cleaning machines to wash or dry-clean industrial or household articles, such as cloth garments, suede, leather, furs, blankets, draperies, linens, rugs, and carpets. Includes spotters and dyers of these articles.

LABEL: presser, textile, garment, or related materials
SubClass Of [NAMED]: presser, textile, garment, or related materials (broad)
alternative term: Pressers, Textile, Garment, and Related Materials
definition: Press or shape articles by hand or machine.

LABEL: sewing machine operator
definition: Operate or tend sewing machines to join, reinforce, decorate, or perform related sewing operations in the manufacture of garment or nongarment products.

LABEL: shoe or leather worker or repairer
alternative term: Shoe and Leather Workers and Repairers
definition: Construct, decorate, or repair leather and leather-like products, such as luggage, shoes, and saddles. May use hand tools.

LABEL: shoe machine operator or tender
definition: Operate or tend a variety of machines to join, decorate, reinforce, or finish shoes and shoe parts.

LABEL: sewer, hand
definition: Sew, join, reinforce, or finish, usually with needle and thread, a variety of manufactured items. Includes weavers and stitchers.

LABEL: tailor, dressmaker, or custom sewer
definition: Design, make, alter, repair, or fit garments.

LABEL: textile bleaching or dyeing machine operator or tender
SubClass Of [NAMED]: textile machine setter, operator, or tender
alternative term: Textile Bleaching and Dyeing Machine Operators and Tenders
definition: Operate or tend machines to bleach, shrink, wash, dye, or finish textiles or synthetic or glass fibers.

LABEL: textile cutting machine setter, operator, or ten
SubClass Of [NAMED]: textile machine setter, operator, or tender
alternative term: Textile Cutting Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders
definition: Set up, operate, or tend machines that cut textiles.

LABEL: textile knitting or weaving machine setter, operator, or tender
SubClass Of [NAMED]: textile machine setter, operator, or tender
alternative term: Textile Knitting and Weaving Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders
definition: Set up, operate, or tend machines that knit, loop, weave, or draw in textiles.

LABEL: textile winding, twisting, or drawing out machine setter, operator, or tender
SubClass Of [NAMED]: textile machine setter, operator, or tender
alternative term: Textile Winding, Twisting, and Drawing Out Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders
definition: Set up, operate, or tend machines that wind or twist textiles; or draw out and combine sliver, such as wool, hemp, or synthetic fibers. Includes slubber machine and drawing frame operators.

LABEL: extruding or forming machine setter, operator, or tender, synthetic or glass fiber
SubClass Of [NAMED]: miscellaneous textile, apparel, or furnishings worker
alternative term: Extruding and Forming Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders, Synthetic and Glass Fibers
definition: Set up, operate, or tend machines that extrude and form continuous filaments from synthetic materials, such as liquid polymer, rayon, and fiberglass.

LABEL: fabric or apparel patternmaker
SubClass Of [NAMED]: miscellaneous textile, apparel, or furnishings worker
definition: Draw and construct sets of precision master fabric patterns or layouts. May also mark and cut fabrics and apparel.

LABEL: upholsterer
SubClass Of [NAMED]: miscellaneous textile, apparel, or furnishings worker
definition: Make, repair, or replace upholstery for household furniture or transportation vehicles.

LABEL: cabinetmaker or bench carpenter
definition: Cut, shape, and assemble wooden articles or set up and operate a variety of woodworking machines, such as power saws, jointers, and mortisers to surface, cut, or shape lumber or to fabricate parts for wood products.

LABEL: furniture finisher
definition: Shape, finish, and refinish damaged, worn, or used furniture or new high-grade furniture to specified color or finish.

LABEL: model maker, wood
definition: Construct full-size and scale wooden precision models of products. Includes wood jig builders and loft workers.

LABEL: patternmaker, wood
definition: Plan, lay out, and construct wooden unit or sectional patterns used in forming sand molds for castings.

LABEL: sawing machine setter, operator, or tender, wood
SubClass Of [NAMED]: woodworking machine setter, operator, or tender
alternative term: Sawing Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders, Wood
definition: Set up, operate, or tend wood sawing machines. May operate computer numerically controlled (CNC) equipment. Includes lead sawyers.

LABEL: woodworking machine setter, operator, or tender, except sawing
SubClass Of [NAMED]: woodworking machine setter, operator, or tender
alternative term: Woodworking Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders, Except Sawing
definition: Set up, operate, or tend woodworking machines, such as drill presses, lathes, shapers, routers, sanders, planers, and wood nailing machines. May operate computer numerically controlled (CNC) equipment.

LABEL: nuclear power reactor operator
SubClass Of [NAMED]: power plant operator, distributor, or dispatcher
definition: Operate or control nuclear reactors. Move control rods, start and stop equipment, monitor and adjust controls, and record data in logs. Implement emergency procedures when needed. May respond to abnormalities, determine cause, and recommend corrective action.

LABEL: power distributor or dispatcher
SubClass Of [NAMED]: power plant operator, distributor, or dispatcher
definition: Coordinate, regulate, or distribute electricity or steam.

LABEL: power plant operator
SubClass Of [NAMED]: power plant operator, distributor, or dispatcher
definition: Control, operate, or maintain machinery to generate electric power. Includes auxiliary equipment operators.

LABEL: biomass plant technician
SubClass Of [NAMED]: power plant operator, distributor, or dispatcher
definition: Control and monitor biomass plant activities and perform maintenance as needed.

LABEL: hydroelectric plant technician
SubClass Of [NAMED]: power plant operator, distributor, or dispatcher
definition: Monitor and control activities associated with hydropower generation. Operate plant equipment, such as turbines, pumps, valves, gates, fans, electric control boards, and battery banks. Monitor equipment operation and performance and make necessary adjustments to ensure optimal performance. Perform equipment maintenance and repair as necessary.

LABEL: stationary engineer or boiler operator
definition: Operate or maintain stationary engines, boilers, or other mechanical equipment to provide utilities for buildings or industrial processes. Operate equipment such as steam engines, generators, motors, turbines, and steam boilers.

LABEL: water or wastewater treatment plant or system operator
SubClass Of [NAMED]: water or wastewater treatment plant or system operator (broad)
alternative term: Water and Wastewater Treatment Plant and System Operators
definition: Operate or control an entire process or system of machines, often through the use of control boards, to transfer or treat water or wastewater.

LABEL: chemical plant or system operator
definition: Control or operate entire chemical processes or system of machines.

LABEL: gas plant operator
definition: Distribute or process gas for utility companies and others by controlling compressors to maintain specified pressures on main pipelines.

LABEL: petroleum pump system operator, refinery operator, or gauger
alternative term: Petroleum Pump System Operators, Refinery Operators, and Gaugers
definition: Operate or control petroleum refining or processing units. May specialize in controlling manifold and pumping systems, gauging or testing oil in storage tanks, or regulating the flow of oil into pipelines.

LABEL: biofuels processing technician
definition: Calculate, measure, load, mix, and process refined feedstock with additives in fermentation or reaction process vessels and monitor production process. Perform, and keep records of, plant maintenance, repairs, and safety inspections.

LABEL: chemical equipment operator or tender
SubClass Of [NAMED]: chemical processing machine setter, operator, or tender
definition: Operate or tend equipment to control chemical changes or reactions in the processing of industrial or consumer products. Equipment used includes devulcanizers, steam-jacketed kettles, and reactor vessels.

LABEL: separating, filtering, clarifying, precipitating, or still machine setter, operator, or tender
SubClass Of [NAMED]: chemical processing machine setter, operator, or tender
alternative term: Separating, Filtering, Clarifying, Precipitating, and Still Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders
definition: Set up, operate, or tend continuous flow or vat-type equipment; filter presses; shaker screens; centrifuges; condenser tubes; precipitating, fermenting, or evaporating tanks; scrubbing towers; or batch stills. These machines extract, sort, or separate liquids, gases, or solids from other materials to recover a refined product. Includes dairy processing equipment operators.

LABEL: crushing, grinding, or polishing machine setter, operator, or tender
SubClass Of [NAMED]: crushing, grinding, polishing, mixing, or blending worker
alternative term: Crushing, Grinding, and Polishing Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders
definition: Set up, operate, or tend machines to crush, grind, or polish materials, such as coal, glass, grain, stone, food, or rubber.

LABEL: grinding or polishing worker, hand
SubClass Of [NAMED]: crushing, grinding, polishing, mixing, or blending worker
definition: Grind, sand, or polish, using hand tools or hand-held power tools, a variety of metal, wood, stone, clay, plastic, or glass objects. Includes chippers, buffers, and finishers.

LABEL: mixing or blending machine setter, operator, or tender
SubClass Of [NAMED]: crushing, grinding, polishing, mixing, or blending worker
alternative term: Mixing and Blending Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders
definition: Set up, operate, or tend machines to mix or blend materials, such as chemicals, tobacco, liquids, color pigments, or explosive ingredients.

LABEL: cutter or trimmer, hand
definition: Use hand tools or hand-held power tools to cut and trim a variety of manufactured items, such as carpet, fabric, stone, glass, or rubber.

LABEL: cutting or slicing machine setter, operator, or tender
alternative term: Cutting and Slicing Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders
definition: Set up, operate, or tend machines that cut or slice materials, such as glass, stone, cork, rubber, tobacco, food, paper, or insulating material.

LABEL: extruding, forming, pressing, or compacting machine setter, operator, or tender
SubClass Of [NAMED]: extruding, forming, pressing, or compacting machine setter, operator, or tender (broad)
alternative term: Extruding, Forming, Pressing, and Compacting Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders
definition: Set up, operate, or tend machines, such as glass-forming machines, plodder machines, and tuber machines, to shape and form products such as glassware, food, rubber, soap, brick, tile, clay, wax, tobacco, or cosmetics.

LABEL: furnace, kiln, oven, drier, or kettle operator or tender
SubClass Of [NAMED]: furnace, Kiln, oven, drier, or Kettle operator or tender (broad)
alternative term: Furnace, Kiln, Oven, Drier, and Kettle Operators and Tenders
definition: Operate or tend heating equipment other than basic metal, plastic, or food processing equipment. Includes activities such as annealing glass, drying lumber, curing rubber, removing moisture from materials, or boiling soap.

LABEL: inspector, tester, sorter, sampler, or weigher
SubClass Of [NAMED]: inspector, tester, sorter, sampler, or weigher (broad)
alternative term: Inspectors, Testers, Sorters, Samplers, and Weighers
definition: Inspect, test, sort, sample, or weigh nonagricultural raw materials or processed, machined, fabricated, or assembled parts or products for defects, wear, and deviations from specifications. May use precision measuring instruments and complex test equipment.

LABEL: gem or diamond worker
SubClass Of [NAMED]: jeweler or precious stone or metal worker (broad)
definition: Fabricate, finish, or evaluate the quality of gems and diamonds used in jewelry or industrial tools.

LABEL: dental laboratory technician
SubClass Of [NAMED]: dental or ophthalmic laboratory technician or medical appliance technician
definition: Construct and repair full or partial dentures or dental appliances.

LABEL: medical appliance technician
SubClass Of [NAMED]: dental or ophthalmic laboratory technician or medical appliance technician
definition: Construct, maintain, or repair medical supportive devices such as braces, orthotics and prosthetic devices, joints, arch supports, and other surgical and medical appliances.

LABEL: ophthalmic laboratory technician
SubClass Of [NAMED]: dental or ophthalmic laboratory technician or medical appliance technician
definition: Cut, grind, and polish eyeglasses, contact lenses, or other precision optical elements. Assemble and mount lenses into frames or process other optical elements. Includes precision lens polishers or grinders, centerer-edgers, and lens mounters.

LABEL: packaging or filling machine operator or tender
SubClass Of [NAMED]: packaging or filling machine operator or tender (broad)
alternative term: Packaging and Filling Machine Operators and Tenders
definition: Operate or tend machines to prepare industrial or consumer products for storage or shipment. Includes cannery workers who pack food products.

LABEL: painting, coating, or decorating worker
definition: Paint, coat, or decorate articles, such as furniture, glass, plateware, pottery, jewelry, toys, books, or leather.

LABEL: coating, painting, or spraying machine setter, operator, or tender
alternative term: Coating, Painting, and Spraying Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders
definition: Set up, operate, or tend spraying or rolling machines to coat or paint any of a wide variety of products, including glassware, cloth, ceramics, metal, plastic, paper, or wood, with lacquer, silver, copper, rubber, varnish, glaze, enamel, oil, or rust-proofing materials. Includes painters of transportation vehicles such as painters in auto body repair facilities.

LABEL: photographic process worker or processing machine operator
SubClass Of [NAMED]: photographic process worker or processing machine operator (broad)
alternative term: Photographic Process Workers and Processing Machine Operators
definition: Perform work involved in developing and processing photographic images from film or digital media. May perform precision tasks such as editing photographic negatives and prints.

LABEL: adhesive bonding machine operator or tender
alternative term: Adhesive Bonding Machine Operators and Tenders
definition: Operate or tend bonding machines that use adhesives to join items for further processing or to form a completed product. Processes include joining veneer sheets into plywood; gluing paper; or joining rubber and rubberized fabric parts, plastic, simulated leather, or other materials.

LABEL: cleaning, washing, or metal pickling equipment operator or tender
alternative term: Cleaning, Washing, and Metal Pickling Equipment Operators and Tenders
definition: Operate or tend machines to wash or clean products, such as barrels or kegs, glass items, tin plate, food, pulp, coal, plastic, or rubber, to remove impurities.

LABEL: cooling or freezing equipment operator or tender
alternative term: Cooling and Freezing Equipment Operators and Tenders
definition: Operate or tend equipment such as cooling and freezing units, refrigerators, batch freezers, and freezing tunnels, to cool or freeze products, food, blood plasma, and chemicals.

LABEL: etcher or engraver
definition: Engrave or etch metal, wood, rubber, or other materials. Includes such workers as etcher-circuit processors, pantograph engravers, and silk screen etchers.

LABEL: stone cutter or carver, manufacturing
definition: Cut or carve stone according to diagrams and patterns.

LABEL: glass blower, molder, bender, or finisher
alternative term: Glass Blowers, Molders, Benders, and Finishers
definition: Shape molten glass according to patterns.

LABEL: potter, manufacturing
definition: Operate production machines such as pug mill, jigger machine, or potter's wheel to process clay in manufacture of ceramic, pottery and stoneware products.

LABEL: paper goods machine setter, operator, or tender
alternative term: Paper Goods Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders
definition: Set up, operate, or tend paper goods machines that perform a variety of functions, such as converting, sawing, corrugating, banding, wrapping, boxing, stitching, forming, or sealing paper or paperboard sheets into products.

LABEL: tire builder
definition: Operate machines to build tires.

LABEL: helpers--production worker
definition: Help production workers by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include supplying or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment.

LABEL: aircraft cargo handling supervisor
SubClass Of [NAMED]: first-line supervisor of transportation or material moving worker
definition: Supervise and coordinate the activities of ground crew in the loading, unloading, securing, and staging of aircraft cargo or baggage. May determine the quantity and orientation of cargo and compute aircraft center of gravity. May accompany aircraft as member of flight crew and monitor and handle cargo in flight, and assist and brief passengers on safety and emergency procedures. Includes loadmasters.

LABEL: first-line supervisor of helpers, laborer, or material mover, hand
SubClass Of [NAMED]: first-line supervisor of transportation or material moving worker
alternative term: First-Line Supervisors of Helpers, Laborers, and Material Movers, Hand
definition: Directly supervise and coordinate the activities of helpers, laborers, or material movers, hand.

LABEL: recycling coordinator
SubClass Of [NAMED]: first-line supervisor of transportation or material moving worker
definition: Supervise curbside and drop-off recycling programs for municipal governments or private firms.

LABEL: airline pilot, copilot, or flight engineer
alternative term: Airline Pilots, Copilots, and Flight Engineers
definition: Pilot and navigate the flight of fixed-wing aircraft, usually on scheduled air carrier routes, for the transport of passengers and cargo. Requires Federal Air Transport certificate and rating for specific aircraft type used. Includes regional, national, and international airline pilots and flight instructors of airline pilots.

LABEL: commercial pilot
definition: Pilot and navigate the flight of fixed-wing aircraft on nonscheduled air carrier routes, or helicopters. Requires Commercial Pilot certificate. Includes charter pilots with similar certification, and air ambulance and air tour pilots. Excludes regional, national, and international airline pilots.

LABEL: air traffic controller
SubClass Of [NAMED]: air traffic controller or airfield operations specialist
definition: Control air traffic on and within vicinity of airport, and movement of air traffic between altitude sectors and control centers, according to established procedures and policies. Authorize, regulate, and control commercial airline flights according to government or company regulations to expedite and ensure flight safety.

LABEL: airfield operations specialist
SubClass Of [NAMED]: air traffic controller or airfield operations specialist
definition: Ensure the safe takeoff and landing of commercial and military aircraft. Duties include coordination between air-traffic control and maintenance personnel, dispatching, using airfield landing and navigational aids, implementing airfield safety procedures, monitoring and maintaining flight records, and applying knowledge of weather information.

LABEL: flight attendant
definition: Monitor safety of the aircraft cabin. Provide services to airline passengers, explain safety information, serve food and beverages, and respond to emergency incidents.

LABEL: ambulance driver or attendant, except emergency medical technician
SubClass Of [NAMED]: ambulance driver or attendant, except emergency medical technician (broad)
alternative term: Ambulance Drivers and Attendants, Except Emergency Medical Technicians
definition: Drive ambulance or assist ambulance driver in transporting sick, injured, or convalescent persons. Assist in lifting patients.

LABEL: driver/sales worker
definition: Drive truck or other vehicle over established routes or within an established territory and sell or deliver goods, such as food products, including restaurant take-out items, or pick up or deliver items such as commercial laundry. May also take orders, collect payment, or stock merchandise at point of delivery.

LABEL: heavy or tractor-trailer truck driver
definition: Drive a tractor-trailer combination or a truck with a capacity of at least 26,001 pounds Gross Vehicle Weight (GVW). May be required to unload truck. Requires commercial drivers' license. Includes tow truck drivers.

LABEL: bus driver, transit or intercity
definition: Drive bus or motor coach, including regular route operations, charters, and private carriage. May assist passengers with baggage. May collect fares or tickets.

LABEL: locomotive engineer
definition: Drive electric, diesel-electric, steam, or gas-turbine-electric locomotives to transport passengers or freight. Interpret train orders, electronic or manual signals, and railroad rules and regulations.

LABEL: rail yard engineer, dinkey operator, or hostler
alternative term: Rail Yard Engineers, Dinkey Operators, and Hostlers
definition: Drive switching or other locomotive or dinkey engines within railroad yard, industrial plant, quarry, construction project, or similar location.

LABEL: railroad conductor or yardmaster
definition: Coordinate activities of switch-engine crew within railroad yard, industrial plant, or similar location. Conductors coordinate activities of train crew on passenger or freight trains. Yardmasters review train schedules and switching orders and coordinate activities of workers engaged in railroad traffic operations, such as the makeup or breakup of trains and yard switching.

LABEL: subway or streetcar operator
definition: Operate subway or elevated suburban trains with no separate locomotive, or electric-powered streetcar, to transport passengers. May handle fares.

LABEL: sailor or marine oiler
definition: Stand watch to look for obstructions in path of vessel, measure water depth, turn wheel on bridge, or use emergency equipment as directed by captain, mate, or pilot. Break out, rig, overhaul, and store cargo-handling gear, stationary rigging, and running gear. Perform a variety of maintenance tasks to preserve the painted surface of the ship and to maintain line and ship equipment. Must hold government-issued certification and tankerman certification when working aboard liquid-carrying vessels. Includes able seamen and ordinary seamen.

LABEL: motorboat operator
SubClass Of [NAMED]: ship or boat captain or operator
definition: Operate small motor-driven boats. May assist in navigational activities.

LABEL: ship engineer
definition: Supervise and coordinate activities of crew engaged in operating and maintaining engines, boilers, deck machinery, and electrical, sanitary, and refrigeration equipment aboard ship.

LABEL: bridge or lock tender
definition: Operate and tend bridges, canal locks, and lighthouses to permit marine passage on inland waterways, near shores, and at danger points in waterway passages. May supervise such operations. Includes drawbridge operators, lock operators, and slip bridge operators.

LABEL: automotive or watercraft service attendant
definition: Service automobiles, buses, trucks, boats, and other automotive or marine vehicles with fuel, lubricants, and accessories. Collect payment for services and supplies. May lubricate vehicle, change motor oil, refill antifreeze, or replace lights or other accessories, such as windshield wiper blades or fan belts. May repair or replace tires.

LABEL: traffic technician
definition: Conduct field studies to determine traffic volume, speed, effectiveness of signals, adequacy of lighting, and other factors influencing traffic conditions, under direction of traffic engineer.

LABEL: aviation inspector
definition: Inspect aircraft, maintenance procedures, air navigational aids, air traffic controls, and communications equipment to ensure conformance with Federal safety regulations.

LABEL: transportation vehicle, equipment or systems inspector, except aviation
alternative term: Transportation Vehicle, Equipment and Systems Inspectors, Except Aviation
definition: Inspect and monitor transportation equipment, vehicles, or systems to ensure compliance with regulations and safety standards.

LABEL: conveyor operator or tender
definition: Control or tend conveyors or conveyor systems that move materials or products to and from stockpiles, processing stations, departments, or vehicles. May control speed and routing of materials or products.

LABEL: crane or tower operator
definition: Operate mechanical boom and cable or tower and cable equipment to lift and move materials, machines, or products in many directions.

LABEL: dredge operator
definition: Operate dredge to remove sand, gravel, or other materials in order to excavate and maintain navigable channels in waterways.

LABEL: hoist or winch operator
definition: Operate or tend hoists or winches to lift and pull loads using power-operated cable equipment.

LABEL: industrial truck or tractor operator
definition: Operate industrial trucks or tractors equipped to move materials around a warehouse, storage yard, factory, construction site, or similar location.

LABEL: cleaner of vehicles or equipment
definition: Wash or otherwise clean vehicles, machinery, and other equipment. Use such materials as water, cleaning agents, brushes, cloths, and hoses.

LABEL: laborer or freight, stock, or material movers, hand
alternative term: Laborers and Freight, Stock, and Material Movers, Hand
definition: Manually move freight, stock, luggage, or other materials, or perform other general labor. Includes all manual laborers not elsewhere classified.

LABEL: recycling or reclamation worker
definition: Prepare and sort materials or products for recycling. Identify and remove hazardous substances. Dismantle components of products such as appliances.

LABEL: machine feeder or offbearer
definition: Feed materials into or remove materials from machines or equipment that is automatic or tended by other workers.

LABEL: packer or packager, hand
definition: Pack or package by hand a wide variety of products and materials.

LABEL: gas compressor or gas pumping station operator
alternative term: Gas Compressor and Gas Pumping Station Operators
definition: Operate steam-, gas-, electric motor-, or internal combustion-engine driven compressors. Transmit, compress, or recover gases, such as butane, nitrogen, hydrogen, and natural gas.

LABEL: pump operator, except wellhead pumper
definition: Tend, control, or operate power-driven, stationary, or portable pumps and manifold systems to transfer gases, oil, other liquids, slurries, or powdered materials to and from various vessels and processes.

LABEL: wellhead pumper
definition: Operate power pumps and auxiliary equipment to produce flow of oil or gas from wells in oil field.

LABEL: refuse or recyclable material collector
definition: Collect and dump refuse or recyclable materials from containers into truck. May drive truck.

LABEL: tank car, truck, or ship loader
SubClass Of [NAMED]: tank car, truck, or ship loader (broad)
alternative term: Tank Car, Truck, and Ship Loaders
definition: Load and unload chemicals and bulk solids, such as coal, sand, and grain, into or from tank cars, trucks, or ships, using material moving equipment. May perform a variety of other tasks relating to shipment of products. May gauge or sample shipping tanks and test them for leaks.

LABEL: top occupation abilities
definition: An annotation property that provides the information of the top and imporant abilities associated with an occupation

LABEL: top occupation skills
definition: An annotation property that provides the information of the top and imporant skills associated with an occupation

LABEL: occupation holder
definition: A human who has a role in society that is realized in an occupation process or an activity as a livelihood (i.e., “means of support or subsistence”). To fulfill such an occupation, the occupation holder is required to have necessary capabilities including skill(s) and abilities. A human who has a role in society that is realized in an occupation process or an activity as a livelihood (i.e., “means of support or subsistence”). To fulfill such an occupation, the occupation holder is required to have necessary capabilities including skill(s) and abilities.
term editor: Sam Smith|Damion Dooley|Eric Merrell|John Beverley|Yongqun He

LABEL: skill
definition: A learned capability to perform an action with determined results with good execution often within a given amount of time, energy, or both.

LABEL: ability
definition: A capability that an agent has to power the performance of various actions.

LABEL: occupation holder with job zone 5
definition: An occupation holder with the job zone number of 5.

LABEL: capability
definition: A disposition that can be evaluated on the basis of how well they are realized. They differ from functions in that their realizations are not the rationale – not the primary reason – for the existence of their bearers.

LABEL: job zone
definition: A job zone is a class of data item that defines: how much education people need to do the work, how much related experience people need to do the work, and how much on-the-job training people need to do the work.

LABEL: job zone 1
definition: Occupations that need little or no preparation

LABEL: job zone 2
definition: Occupations that need some preparation

LABEL: job zone 3
definition: Occupations that need medium preparation

LABEL: job zone 4
definition: Occupations that need considerable preparation

LABEL: job zone 5
definition: Occupations that need extensive preparation

LABEL: occupation holder with job zone 4
definition: An occupation holder with the job zone number of 4.

LABEL: occupation holder with job zone 3
definition: An occupation holder with the job zone number of 3.

LABEL: occupation holder with job zone 2
definition: An occupation holder with the job zone number of 2.

LABEL: occupation holder with job zone 1
definition: An occupation holder with the job zone number of 1.

LABEL: regulated occupation activity
definition: An occupation activity which the occupation holder must be authorized to perform in a given jurisdiction (timeframe etc).

LABEL: illicit occupation activity
definition: An occupation activity which is illegal or ostracized in a given jurisdiction.

LABEL: holder of regulated occupation activity
definition: A person who is the bearer of a disposition to perform a socially-sanctioned occupation activity

LABEL: holder of illicit occupation activity
alternative term: holder of illicit occupation|holder of socially-sanctioned occupation|holder of socially-sanctioned occupation acitivity
definition: A person who is the bearer of a disposition to perform a socially-sanctioned occupation acitivity.

LABEL: legislator
definition: Develop, introduce, or enact laws and statutes at the local, tribal, state, or federal level. Includes only workers in elected positions.

LABEL: advertising, marketing, promotions, public relations, or sales manager
alternative term: Advertising, Marketing, Promotions, Public Relations, and Sales Managers

LABEL: advertising or promotions manager (broad)
SubClass Of [NAMED]: advertising, marketing, promotions, public relations, or sales manager

LABEL: marketing or sales manager

LABEL: air crew officer

definition: Perform and direct in-flight duties to ensure the successful completion of combat, reconnaissance, transport, and search and rescue missions. Duties include operating aircraft communications and radar equipment, such as establishing satellite linkages and jamming enemy communications capabilities; operating aircraft weapons and defensive systems; conducting preflight, in-flight, and postflight inspections of onboard equipment; and directing cargo and personnel drops.

LABEL: aircraft launch or recovery officer
SubClass Of [NAMED]: military officer special or tactical operations leader
definition: Plan and direct the operation and maintenance of catapults, arresting gear, and associated mechanical, hydraulic, and control systems involved primarily in aircraft carrier takeoff and landing operations. Duties include supervision of readiness and safety of arresting gear, launching equipment, barricades, and visual landing aid systems; planning and coordinating the design, development, and testing of launch and recovery systems; preparing specifications for catapult and arresting gear installations; evaluating design proposals; determining handling equipment needed for new aircraft; preparing technical data and instructions for operation of landing aids; and training personnel in carrier takeoff and landing procedures.

LABEL: armored assault vehicle officer
SubClass Of [NAMED]: military officer special or tactical operations leader
definition: Direct the operation of tanks, light armor, and amphibious assault vehicle units during combat situations on land or in aquatic environments. Duties include directing crew members in the operation of targeting and firing systems; coordinating the operation of advanced onboard communications and navigation equipment; directing the transport of personnel and equipment during combat; formulating and implementing battle plans, including the tactical employment of armored vehicle units; and coordinating with infantry, artillery, and air support units.

LABEL: artillery or missile officer
SubClass Of [NAMED]: military officer special or tactical operations leader
definition: Manage personnel and weapons operations to destroy enemy positions, aircraft, and vessels. Duties include planning, targeting, and coordinating the tactical deployment of field artillery and air defense artillery missile systems units; directing the establishment and operation of fire control communications systems; targeting and launching intercontinental ballistic missiles; directing the storage and handling of nuclear munitions and components; overseeing security of weapons storage and launch facilities; and managing maintenance of weapons systems.

LABEL: command or control center officer
SubClass Of [NAMED]: military officer special or tactical operations leader
definition: Manage the operation of communications, detection, and weapons systems essential for controlling air, ground, and naval operations. Duties include managing critical communication links between air, naval, and ground forces; formulating and implementing emergency plans for natural and wartime disasters; coordinating emergency response teams and agencies; evaluating command center information and need for high-level military and government reporting; managing the operation of surveillance and detection systems; providing technical information and advice on capabilities and operational readiness; and directing operation of weapons targeting, firing, and launch computer systems.

LABEL: infantry officer
SubClass Of [NAMED]: military officer special or tactical operations leader
definition: Direct, train, and lead infantry units in ground combat operations. Duties include directing deployment of infantry weapons, vehicles, and equipment; directing location, construction, and camouflage of infantry positions and equipment; managing field communications operations; coordinating with armor, artillery, and air support units; performing strategic and tactical planning, including battle plan development; and leading basic reconnaissance operations.

LABEL: special forces officer
SubClass Of [NAMED]: military officer special or tactical operations leader
definition: Lead elite teams that implement unconventional operations by air, land, or sea during combat or peacetime. These activities include offensive raids, demolitions, reconnaissance, search and rescue, and counterterrorism. In addition to their combat training, special forces officers often have specialized training in swimming, diving, parachuting, survival, emergency medicine, and foreign languages. Duties include directing advanced reconnaissance operations and evaluating intelligence information; recruiting, training, and equipping friendly forces; leading raids and invasions on enemy territories; training personnel to implement individual missions and contingency plans; performing strategic and tactical planning for politically sensitive missions; and operating sophisticated communications equipment.

LABEL: aircraft launch or recovery specialist

LABEL: armored assault vehicle crew member

LABEL: artillery or missile crew member

definition: Target, fire, and maintain weapons used to destroy enemy positions, aircraft, and vessels. Field artillery crew members predominantly use guns, cannons, and howitzers in ground combat operations, while air defense artillery crew members predominantly use missiles and rockets. Naval artillery crew members predominantly use torpedoes and missiles launched from a ship or submarine. Duties include testing, inspecting, and storing ammunition, missiles, and torpedoes; conducting preventive and routine maintenance on weapons and related equipment; establishing and maintaining radio and wire communications; and operating weapons targeting, firing, and launch computer systems.

LABEL: command or control center specialist

definition: Operate and monitor communications, detection, and weapons systems essential for controlling air, ground, and naval operations. LABEL: infantry

definition: Operate weapons and equipment in ground combat operations. Duties include operating and maintaining weapons, such as rifles, machine guns, mortars, and hand grenades; locating, constructing, and camouflaging infantry positions and equipment; evaluating terrain and recording topographical information; operating and maintaining field communications equipment; assessing need for and directing supporting fire; placing explosives and performing minesweeping activities on land; and participating in basic reconnaissance operations.

LABEL: special forces
SubClass Of [NAMED]: military enlisted tactical operations or air/weapons specialist or crew member
definition: Implement unconventional operations by air, land, or sea during combat or peacetime as members of elite teams. These activities include offensive raids, demolitions, reconnaissance, search and rescue, and counterterrorism. In addition to their combat training, special forces members often have specialized training in swimming, diving, parachuting, survival, emergency medicine, and foreign languages. Duties include conducting advanced reconnaissance operations and collecting intelligence information; recruiting, training, and equipping friendly forces; conducting raids and invasions on enemy territories; laying and detonating explosives for demolition targets; locating, identifying, defusing, and disposing of ordnance; and operating and maintaining sophisticated communications equipment.
